cont.entity_a: Better sound including simulated surround. Minimal sound leakage. Good sound, but stopped working after a month. Sennheiser phones provide true hifi sound. Clarity and reception better than Advent brand with occasional static.
cont.entity_b: Comfortable and crisp sound. Decent lows for pop/rock but lacking for hip-hop. Balanced in high and mid sections. Bright sound and hard clamp can cause discomfort. Better than laptop speakers with good clear sound.

cont.entity_a: Better fit and wireless capability. Poor fit, presses on ears. Headphones are lightweight and comfortable. Recommended for users with hearing aids due to large ear coverings.
cont.entity_b: Uncomfortable due to small ear holes. Bright sound and hard clamp can cause discomfort. Comfortable and good sound for portable use.

cont.entity_a: Way better battery life with an extra battery always charged. Battery lasts only four hours.
Poor construction; headphones broke after a few months. Cheap material and static noise when moving head. No problems with breakage or wear after a year of use.
cont.entity_b: Subpar build quality; plastic pieces break easily. Plastic construction leads to easy breakage.

cont.entity_a: Reception is good but cuts out when phone rings. Reception cuts out when moving outside range. Good range inside and outside the house.
Volume control is hard to find. Not satisfied with volume despite good surround sound. Volume issues when using with certain devices.

cont.entity_b: Comfortable and crisp sound. Uncomfortable due to small ear holes. Bright sound and hard clamp can cause discomfort. Comfortable and good sound for portable use.
Decent lows for pop/rock but lacking for hip-hop. Weak bass and plastic broke within 6 months. Bass is weak and plastic broke inside 6 months.
Not as good as Bose but a great deal for the price.

cont.entity_a: Good discriminator, keeping noise to a minimum.
cont.entity_b: No noticeable noise cancelling white noise.
Short cord limits movement. Good clean quality and portable.
